name: DNPipe
short_description:
DNPipe, a pipeline that  filters de novo assemblies to improve their quality. This helps in boosting all applications based on metatranscriptomic assembly. Original assemblies should be based on De Bruijn graphs created by Oases. Auxiliary scripts that help reporting statistics about all kinds of assemblies are also integrated with the pipeline.

Experimental results show that DNPipe improves the precision against ref-based GOLD standard while
 filtering out thousands of transcripts. Each original assembly was made up of 20000+ transcripts. High precision of filtered assemblies and considerably short execution time (16 to 20 minutes) of the pipeline makes it a desirable postprocessing step of de novo assemblies.

For more details on the execution of the pipeline, please refer to DNPipe_Manual.pdf (in Files/).

For inquiries, please contact us at hmohsen@indiana.edu.
summary: A machine learning pipeline to improve de novo assemblies
